wikipedia_page.main: Robin "Bob" Coverdale (fourth ¼ 1928 – May 21, 2009), also known by the nickname of "The Mayor of Dunswell", was an English World Cup winning professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s, and coached in the 1970s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, and at club level for Hull FC, Wakefield Trinity (Heritage № 635), and Hull Kingston Rovers (Heritage №), as a prop, i.e. number 8 or 10, during the era of contested scrums, and coached at club level for Beverley A.R.L.F.C..
